properties.areaDesc: Interior Hancock; Coastal Hancock; Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Southern Penobscot
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 9:06PM EST until February 8 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Caribou ME
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations
of 6 to 10 inches, sleet accumulations of around one inch and
ice accumulations of one tenth to one quarter of an inch
expected.

* WHERE...Portions of Coastal DownEast, Interior DownEast and
Penobscot Valley Maine.

* WHEN...From 7 AM Thursday to 4 AM EST Saturday. Light snow
will move into the area on Thursday morning with mixed
precipitation moving in Thursday evening. Heavy mixed
precipitation is expected during the day on Friday changing to
all snow Friday evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening
commutes on Thursday and will impact the commutes on Friday.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to
newengland511.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM EST SATURDAY
